metadata.title: CVE-2014-3152 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer underflow in the LCodeGen::PrepareKeyedOperand function inarm/lithium-codegen-arm.cc in Google V8 before 3.25.28.16, as used inGoogle Chrome before 35.0.1916.114, allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectorsthat trigger a negative key value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-browser-l10n - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-chromedriver - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '35.0.1916.153-0ubuntu1~pkg1029').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.0~bzr640-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
